pl_remarks: 1. The plant height is the height from the ground to the base leaf (i.e. trunk height)

2. Sensors were installed in leaf petioles rather than in the trunk because vessel density is presumably higher and distributed more homogeneously, and also due to the practical constraints of installation in tree trunks.
3. The sapwood area is calculated by multiplying the average cross section area of leaf petioles by the average leaf numbers per palm.
Details on basic considerations and technical specifications of field installation and laboratory calibration please refer to Niu et al., 2015 (http://doi:10.1093/treephys/tpv013)
